general_advisory: Based on the above forecast farmers can now resume intercultural operations, fertilization and spraying of plant protection chemicals as required. Considering the realized and anticipated rainfall, farmers are advised to complete the transplanting of paddy by 15th of August. Farmers are advised not to apply fertilizer and herbicides in rice fields when there is not sufficient soil moisture. Make arrangements for draining out excess water from the fields of pulses, maize, groundnut, and vegetables. Due to the prevailing cloudy weather associated with high humidity, regular monitoring for the occurrence of insects and diseases in crops is highly recommended. Additionally, specific advisories for different crops have been provided.

advisory: Pest Management: If leaf blast is observed in rice field, spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG (Nativo) @ 80 g/acre or Isoprothiolane 40 EC (Sultan/Fujita/Fujione) @ 300 ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water. Repeat the spray at 7-10 days interval.

There is a chance of infestation of sheath rot and sheath blight in paddy. To manage this disease, spray Tebuconazole 50% + Trifloxystrobin 25% WG (Nativo) @ 80 gram/acre or Propiconazole 25% EC (Tilt/Zerox/Dhan/Bumper) @ 200ml/acre by mixing with 200 liters of water.

Recommended dose of Fertilizer: Apply 26 kg DAP + 10 kg MOP + 10 kg ZnSO4 in upland condition and 35 kg DAP + 13 kg MOP + 10 kg ZnSO4 per acre in medium and low land conditions as basal application. In boron deficient soil apply borax@2kg/ac during final land preparation.
Transplanting of 20-25 days old seedlings is recommended @ 2-3 seedlings/hill at a spacing of 20x15 cm.
Make drainage channel for draining out excess rainwater.

Undertake hoeing, weeding, and 1st top dressing followed by earthing up at three-week stage of cotton. Apply 26 kg urea with 20 kg MOP in hybrids and 20 kg urea with 15 kg MOP in high yielding varieties as 1st top dressing.
Create drainage channel to drain away excess rainwater.
Hoeing, weeding followed by earthing up should be completed by the end of this week.
Monitor your field regularly for signs of pest infestation. To prevent sucking pests like aphids and thrips, neem-based pesticide (1500 ppm) may be sprayed @ 3ml/lit of water.
Develop a better drainage system to avoid waterlogging conditions due to excess rainfall.
Hoeing, weeding and 1st top dressing followed by earthing up should be completed by the end of this week. Apply urea @ 75 kg/ac as 1st top dressing.
Stem borer and banded leaf and sheath blight may appear at this stage. Monitor the field regularly and remove infected plant parts.
Transplant 30-45 days old seedlings in the main field.
Make necessary drainage channels to prevent waterlogging conditions.

Remove infected plant and bury them away from the field.

Seed treatment, sowing, and followed by the application of paddy straw mulching is advised to obtain good seedlings.
Apply Chloropyriphos @ 1ml/lit of water to prevent termite infestation.

Select suitable variety like, Banganpalli, Totapuri, Bombay green, Subarnarekha, Neelam, Himsagar, Langra, Dusheri, Amrapalli, Mallika, Ratna, Ramkella, Rummani, Sindhu, Alphanso, and Keshar etc. Use healthy unbranched grafted seedlings.
Plant the saplings in 1m x 1m x 1m pit at 10m x 10m distance. Apply 5kg FYM/pit before planting.
This is a suitable time for planting papaya.
HYV for papaya are Honeydew, Coorg honeydew, CO-1, CO-2, Pusa delicious, Pusa Majesty, and Pusa giant.

Plant the seedling at 2.5m x 2.5m distance and 0.5m x 0.5m x 0.5m pit. Disease resistance and tissue culture seedlings should be used. Apply a mixture of topsoil and well-rotten FYM in the pit before planting.
